com.nutiteq
Class MapView

java.lang.Object
  android.view.View
      android.view.SurfaceView
          android.opengl.GLSurfaceView
              com.nutiteq.MapView
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback
public class MapView
extends android.opengl.GLSurfaceView

The main view class for all mapping operations. Allows the user to manipulate the map and access various related components. Please note that as this class is derived from GLSurfaceView, it behaves differently from most Views. It is strongly recommended to NOT create multiple MapView instances in your activity, as GLSurfaceView is really a separate surface that is created and Z-ordered behind its containing window. GLSurfaceView Z ordering is different from normal view Z ordering.

screenToWorld

public MapPos screenToWorld(double x,
                            double y)
Calculates the world map position from screen point coordinates.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of point in screen space
y - the y coordinate of point in screen space
Returns:
corresponding map point coordinates in world space (at ground plane, thus z is 0)

screenToWorld

@Deprecated
public MapPos screenToWorld(double x,
                                       double y,
                                       float frac)
Deprecated. 

Calculates the world map position from the screen point and relative distance between near and far plane of the camera. Note: this function is deprecated, use screenToWorld(double, double) instead.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the screen point
y - the y coordinate of the screen point
frac - relative distance between near and far plane of the camera. 0 corresponds to the near plane and 1 to the far plane.
Returns:
corresponding map point coordinates in world space.

worldToScreen

public MapPos worldToScreen(double x,
                            double y,
                            double z)
Calculates the screen coordinates for given map position.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the map point
y - the y coordinate of the map point
z - the z coordinate of the map point
Returns:
corresponding screen point coordinates. Note: returned z coordinate is always 0.

mapTileToWorld

public MapPos mapTileToWorld(MapTile mapTile,
                             MapPos tilePos)
Calculate world coordinates from map tile and tile local coordinates.

Parameters:
mapTile - map tile
tilePos - tile local coordinates of the point. Tile local coordinates are in 0..1 range.
Returns:
corresponding map point coordinates in world space.

worldToMapTile

public MapTile worldToMapTile(double x,
                              double y,
                              MutableMapPos tilePos)
Get map tile corresponding to world coordinates. Also return local coordinates within the tile. Tile zoom level is calculated based on current view.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the map point
y - the y coordinate of the map point
tilePos - tile local coordinates of the point. Tile local coordinates are in 0..1 range.
Returns:
tile corresponding to given coordinates or null if no such tile exists

worldToMapTile

public MapTile worldToMapTile(double x,
                              double y,
                              int zoom,
                              MutableMapPos tilePos)
Get map tile corresponding to world coordinates and given zoom level. Also return local coordinates within the tile.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the map point
y - the y coordinate of the map point
zoom - zoom level for the tile to return.
tilePos - tile local coordinates of the point. Tile local coordinates are in 0..1 range.
Returns:
tile corresponding to given coordinates or null if no such tile exists

public MapPos getFocusPoint()

Returns:

setFocusPoint

public void setFocusPoint(double x,
                          double y)
Sets the position of the point that the camera should be looking at, in current base map's projection. The resulting focus point position is capped to world range. The focus point's position can be further constrained by the Constrains.setBounds method.

Parameters:
x - the x component of the new focus point
y - the y component of the new focus point

setFocusPoint

public void setFocusPoint(MapPos focusPoint)
Sets the position of the point that the camera should be looking at, in current base map's projection. The resulting focus point position is capped to world range. The focus point's position can be further constrained by the Constrains.setBounds method.

Parameters:
focusPoint - the new focus point

setFocusPoint

public void setFocusPoint(MapPos focusPoint,
                          int duration)
Animates the the position of the point that the camera should be looking at. The position is given in current base map's projection. If this method is called before the old animation has finished, old animation will be canceled.

Parameters:
focusPoint - the new focus point
duration - duration of animation in milliseconds

getRotation

@Deprecated
public float getRotation()
Deprecated. 

Gets the current map rotation in degrees. 0 means looking to north, 90 means west, 180 means south and 270 means east. Note: this function is deprecated, use getMapRotation() instead.

Returns:
the current map rotation in degrees

the current map rotation in degrees

rotate

public void rotate(float deltaAngle)
Sets the rotation of the map relative to the current rotation angle. Positive values rotate clockwise, negative values counterclockwise.

Parameters:
deltaAngle - the number of degrees the map should be rotate by

rotate

public void rotate(float deltaAngle,
                   int duration)
Animates the rotation of the map by the given angle. Positive values rotate clockwise, negative values counterclockwise. If this method is called before the old animation has finished, old animation will be canceled.

Parameters:
deltaAngle - the number of degrees the map should be rotate by
duration - duration of animation in milliseconds

getTilt

public float getTilt()
Gets the current tilt angle in degrees. 0 means looking directly at the horizon, 90 means looking directly down.

Returns:
the current tilt angle in degrees

setTilt

public void setTilt(float angle)
Sets the new absolute tilt angle in degrees. 0 means look directly at the horizon, 90 means look directly down. The minimum tilt angle is 30 degrees and the maximum is 90 degrees. The tilt angle can be further constrained by the Constraints.setTileRange method. Values exceeding these ranges will be capped.

Parameters:
angle - the new absolute tilt angle in degrees

tilt

public void tilt(float deltaAngle)
Sets the new tilt angle relative to the current tilt angle. Positive values tilt the camera towards look at the ground, negative values tilt the camera towards looking at the horizon. The new calculated tilt angle will be capped to a range as specified in setTilt.

Parameters:
deltaAngle - the number of degrees the camera should be tilted by

tilt

public void tilt(float deltaAngle,
                 int duration)
Animate the new angle relative to the current tilt angle. Positive values tilt the camera towards look at the ground, negative values tilt the camera towards looking at the horizon. The new calculated tilt angle will be capped to a range as specified in setTilt. If this method is called before the old animation has finished, old animation will be canceled.

Parameters:
deltaAngle - the number of degrees the camera should be tilted by
duration - duration of animation in milliseconds

getZoom

public float getZoom()
Gets the current zoom level. The value returned is never negative, 0 means absolutely zoomed out and all other values describe some level of zoom.

Returns:
the current zoom value

setZoom

public void setZoom(float zoom)
Sets the new absolute zoom value. The minimum zoom value is 0, which means absolutely zoomed out and the maximum zoom value is 24. The zoom value can be further constrained by the Constraints.setZoomRange method. Values exceeding these ranges will be capped.

Parameters:
zoom - the new absolute zoom value

zoom

public void zoom(float deltaZoom)
Sets the new zoom value relative to the current zoom value. Positive values zoom in, negative values zoom out. The new calculated zoom value will be capped to range as specified in setZoom.

Parameters:
deltaZoom - the delta zoom value

zoom

public void zoom(float deltaZoom,
                 int duration)
Animate zoom relative to the current zoom value. Positive values zoom in, negative values zoom out. The new calculated zoom value will be capped to range as specified in setZoom. If this method is called before the old animation has finished, old animation will be canceled.

Parameters:
deltaZoom - the delta zoom value
duration - duration of animation in milliseconds

zoomIn

public void zoomIn()
Zooms in by 1. Convenience method for calling zoom(1, 300).

zoomOut

public void zoomOut()
Zooms out by 1. Convenience method for calling zoom(-1, 300).

setBoundingBox

public void setBoundingBox(Bounds bounds,
                           boolean integerZoom)
Set map view parameters (focus position, zoom tilt, rotation) so that the specified bounding box becomes fully visible. Note: this method needs view dimensions, which are not available when called from onCreate. Thus incorrect bounding area can be calculated (it is calculated based on screen dimensions in that case)

Parameters:
bounds - bounds for the view
integerZoom - true if closest integer zoom level should be used, false if exact fractional zoom level should be used

setBoundingBox

public void setBoundingBox(Bounds bounds,
                           boolean integerZoom,
                           int duration)
Animate the view parameters (focus position, zoom tilt, rotation) so that the specified bounding box becomes fully visible. Note: this method needs view dimensions, which are not available when called from onCreate. Thus incorrect bounding area can be calculated (it is calculated based on screen dimensions in that case)

Parameters:
bounds - bounds for the view
integerZoom - true if closest integer zoom level should be used, false if exact fractional zoom level should be used
duration - duration of animation in milliseconds

setBoundingBox

public void setBoundingBox(Bounds bounds,
                           android.graphics.Rect rect,
                           boolean integerZoom,
                           boolean resetTilt,
                           boolean resetRotation,
                           int duration)
Animate the view parameters (focus position, tilt, rotation, zoom) so that the specified bounding box becomes fully visible.

Parameters:
bounds - map bounds for the view (in base projection coordinates)
rect - rectangle (in screen coordinates) to fit the map bounds into
integerZoom - if true, then closest integer zoom level will be used. If false, exact fractional zoom level will be used.
resetTilt - if true, view will be untilted. If false, current tilt will be kept.
resetRotation - if true, rotation will be reset. If false, current rotation will be kept.
duration - duration of animation in milliseconds

selectVectorElement

public void selectVectorElement(VectorElement vectorElement)
Makes the label of the specified marker visible. Does NOT move the map to make the marker visible on the screen.

Parameters:
vectorElement - the element to be selected. Element has to be attached to a layer to be selected.

deselectVectorElement

public void deselectVectorElement()
Hides the label of the currently selected marker, if there is one.

registerLicense

public static boolean registerLicense(java.lang.String license,
                                      android.content.Context context)
Register SDK license. Note: this is class method and must be called before creating any actual MapView instances!

Parameters:
license - license string provided for this application
context - application context for the license
Returns:
true is license was accepted, false if not.

setWatermark

public static void setWatermark(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                                float xPos,
                                float yPos,
                                float scale)
Set custom watermark replacing default SDK watermark. Note: this method is only available for valid SDK licenses, MapView.registerLicense must be called before this method.

Parameters:
bitmap - watermark bitmap to use or null. Note: bitmap.getConfig() must return ARGB_8888.
xPos - watermark relative x position on screen between -1.0f (left) to 1.0f (right)
yPos - watermark relative y position on screen between -1.0f (bottom) to 1.0f (top)
scale - watermark relative scale on screen
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the license does not allow watermark customization.
